reviewText:
I got this game for $0.99 thinking that if it was bad, it wasn't exactly expensive. I'm glad that is all the game cost.

It wasn't a terrible game but that being said it certainly wasn't what i would call good. This may be because it is the developers first attempt or whatever and hence the low price point.

Here are my major issues with the game:
- Time: the playthrough took me 30mins. idk, I may have missed something but it seems to be a really, really short game
- Controls: these drove me crazy!!! walking was very, very slow so i just sprinted everywhere; Even though there appeared to be no height difference between the sidewalk and the road, I had to jump up onto the pavement. Going up stairs was basically spamming the jump button.
- No pause menu: hitting esc just sent you back to the title screen
- Story: ok, I must have missed some stuff but i think I got the general gist of the story and, to be honest, it was pretty uninspiring.

Honestly, I can't recommend the game, even at the low price simply because it has nothing going for it. It will waste 30 mins of your life.

reviewText:
It's a rather short experience, and while it is interesting, I cannot recommend it due to it's design choices, glitches and technical problems.

PROS . Interesting story, though it tries too hard
. It is not a linear game, you can explore the city all you want, and piece the story together at your own pace
. Focuses more on storytelling and ambience rather than jumpscares.
. Attention to detail can be found throughout the city.
. Voice acting is ok.

CONS . Gameplay is janky (you have to jump to get on stairs, sidewalks, even doorways)
. Lighting is all over the place, some doors flash white.
. Some really weird design decisions: there's a flashlight in one of the city's buildings, but you can't take it, you have to keep your lighter.
. The lighter doesn't light anything.
. I kept hearing footsteps, the whole game, even when I was standing still. (not sure if it's a glitch)
. The menu doesn't work properly, I can only press the Play" button
date: "Continue" and "Quit" don't work.\n\nIt's a nice effort
voteText: is a real nice guy. If he and his crew can fix all these little technical problems
helpfulPercent:
it would be an above average game.

reviewText: Theres evidence that there was work put into this game and it doesn't look bad at all. However, it's extremely buggy and the story is incredibly slow. The controls are a little wacked, you can't walk up inch-high curbs and most of the time when you walk straight, it veers you to the left or right. With some work, debugging, and maybe a change of pace this game could be worth more than a dollar, but right now, I'm not sure it's worth that.

reviewText:
Here's a fp-horror game on steam, rolling your eyes? Then this isn't going to be the game for you. So with that said allow me to elaborate.

You wake from a journey in the boot of a car, and make your escape into the small town of “Verdant Creek”, you find the town abandoned and thus begins your journey to discover why/where/how you're here.

There's no combat and the majority of your enjoyment will come from completing puzzles and traversing the map, you'll almost immediately notice that the game is styled in the vain of Silent Hill, and for an independent title it comes close at times, though it still needs that extra push.

If that sounds like your jam here's a short game (an hour or two) costing less than a quid, I feel you'll get your money's worth, however it's pretty much going to be an investment into an ongoing project from a new dev team, so take it with a grain of salt, but do have a bite.

reviewText:
Retaliation!
A very interesting STUDENT PROJECT. Its great when these pop up on steam as it allows for everyone to witness the talent that now coming out from recent graduates.

Now to be crtical its not the best game out on steam It has bugs, the movement is a bit weird and a few other things, its a student project. However, it is also not as well funded as other games are on steam. The story is interesting, its different to the standard story you get from most games as it tackles the idea of a lost person in a ghost town and his journey to understand what happened to the people. As you travel throughout the town and discover more recordings of the story you gradually learn more about the children of the town and how some drug called an Oxy had a devestating effect on everyone. An interesting concept, would love to of seen where it could of gone with money or a big studio backing it.

Besides for the sake of something that costs lest than a costa coffee what have you got to lose.

reviewText: I was a bit frustrated at first with this game as it had all of the right elements for a good game in my opinion, cool story, first person, spooky atmosphere but alas, I could not get it to play. Luckily the developer got the game to run despite its quirkiness and off I went! Firstly, this game is only 99 cents, and it is way worth that much money. So much of the time big games will have beautiful graphics and  but absolutely no storyline, just shoot and be shot at. This game, however, has a very interesting story behind it which has kept my interest so far. A quick synopsis~You wake up in a van with no knowledge of what happened nor who the person is who has abducted you. This stranger (or is it a stranger?)  subsequently dumps you in the middle of what at first appears to be the woods. After some walking around you discover that in fact you are in an abandoned town . It has a bit of an open world feel but it is small. Despite this, it is very nicely done and delivers a good creepy atmosphere.  I wont write more about the story but this scenario grabbed me. Yes, the graphics are a little clunky but there are moments of very pretty scenes like the night sky with a full moon that make up for this, and there was a few little oddities like one has to jump up to get on the sidewalk to walk as if there is a small wall around the sidewalk but otherwise the game ran well and is definitely worth it if you like a creepy tale, exploring, puzzles and a mystery to solve. I enjoyed it quite a bit~ 8/10 (with a bit of smoothing this game could be a ten I think)
